001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import squidpony.squidmath.Bresenham;
004import squidpony.squidmath.Coord;
005import squidpony.squidmath.DDALine;
006import squidpony.squidmath.Elias;
007import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedSet;
008import squidpony.squidmath.OrthoLine;
009
010import java.io.Serializable;
011import java.util.ArrayDeque;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.List;
014
015/**
016 * Line of Sight (LOS) algorithms find if there is or is not a path between two
017 * given points.
018 * <br>
019 * The line found between two points will end at either the target, the
020 * obstruction closest to the start, or the edge of the map.
021 * <br>
022 * For normal line of sight usage, you should prefer Bresenham lines, and these
023 * are the default (they can also be specified by passing {@link #BRESENHAM} to
024 * the constructor). For more specialized usage, there are other kinds of LOS in
025 * this class, like lines that make no diagonal moves between cells (using
026 * {@link #ORTHO}, or lines that check a wide path (but these use different
027 * methods, like {@link #thickReachable(Radius)}).
028 * <br>
029 * Performance-wise, all of these methods are rather fast and about the same speed.
030 * {@link #RAY} is a tiny fraction faster than {@link #BRESENHAM} but produces
031 * rather low-quality lines in comparison. Calculating the visibility of 40,000
032 * lines in a 102x102 dungeon takes within 3% of 950ms (on an Intel i7-4700MQ laptop
033 * processor) for every one of BRESENHAM, DDA, ORTHO, and RAY, even with ORTHO
034 * finding a different kind of line by design.
035 *
036 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
037 * @author Tommy Ettinger Added DDA, ORTHO, and the thick lines; some cleanup
038 * @author smelC optimized several methods
039 */
040public class LOS implements Serializable {
041    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
042    //constants to indicate desired type of solving algorithm to use
043    /**
044     * A Bresenham-based line-of-sight algorithm.
045     */
046    public static final int BRESENHAM = 1;
047    /**
048     * Uses Wu's Algorithm as modified by Elias to draw the line. Does
049     * not end at an obstruction but rather returns one of the possible
050     * attempted paths in full.
051     */
052    public static final int ELIAS = 2;
053    /**
054     * Uses a series of rays internal to the start and end point to
055     * determine visibility. Appearance is extremely close to DDA, which
056     * is also probably a faster algorithm, so BRESENHAM (which can look
057     * a little better) and DDA are recommended instead of RAY.
058     */
059    public static final int RAY = 3;
060    /**
061     * Draws a line using only North/South/East/West movement.
062     */
063    public static final int ORTHO = 4;
064    /**
065     * Optimized algorithm for Bresenham-like lines. There are slight
066     * differences in many parts of the lines this draws when compared
067     * to Bresenham lines, but it may also perform significantly better,
068     * and may also be useful as a building block for more complex LOS.
069     * Virtually identical in results to RAY, and just a hair slower, but
070     * better-tested and more predictable.
071     */
072    public static final int DDA = 5;
073    /**
074     * Draws a line as if with a thick brush, going from a point between
075     * a corner of the starting cell and the center of the starting cell
076     * to the corresponding corner of the target cell, and considers the
077     * target visible if any portion of the thick stroke reached it. Will
078     * result in 1-width lines for exactly-orthogonal or exactly-diagonal
079     * lines and some parts of other lines, but usually is 2 cells wide.
080     */
081    public static final int THICK = 6;
082    private ArrayDeque<Coord> lastPath = new ArrayDeque<>();
083    private int type;
084    private double[][] resistanceMap;
085    private int startx, starty, targetx, targety;
086    private Elias elias;
087    private LOS los1, los2;
088    /**
089     * Gets the radius strategy this uses.
090     * @return the current Radius enum used to measure distance; starts at CIRCLE if not specified
091     */
092    public Radius getRadiusStrategy() {
093        return radiusStrategy;
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Set the radius strategy to the given Radius; the default is CIRCLE if this is not called.
098     * @param radiusStrategy a Radius enum to determine how distances are measured
099     */
100    public void setRadiusStrategy(Radius radiusStrategy) {
101        this.radiusStrategy = radiusStrategy;
102    }
103
104    private Radius radiusStrategy = Radius.CIRCLE;
105
106    /**
107     * Constructs an LOS that will draw Bresenham lines and measure distances using the CIRCLE radius strategy.
108     */
109    public LOS() {
110        this(BRESENHAM);
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Constructs an LOS with the given type number, which must equal a static field in this class such as BRESENHAM.
115     * @param type an int that must correspond to the value of a static field in this class (such as BRESENHAM)
116     */
117    public LOS(int type) {
118        this.type = type;
119        if(type == ELIAS)
120        {
121            elias = new Elias();
122            los1 = new LOS(BRESENHAM);
123            los2 = new LOS(BRESENHAM);
124
125        }
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target
130     * point without intervening obstructions.
131     *
132     * Uses RadiusStrategy.CIRCLE, or whatever RadiusStrategy was set with setRadiusStrategy .
133     *
134     * @param walls '#' is fully opaque, anything else is fully transparent, as always this uses x,y indexing.
135     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
136     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
137     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
138     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
139     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
140     */
141    public boolean isReachable(char[][] walls, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety) {
142        if(walls.length < 1) return false;
143        if(resistanceMap == null || resistanceMap.length != walls.length || resistanceMap[0].length != walls[0].length)
144            resistanceMap = new double[walls.length][walls[0].length];
145        for(int x = 0; x < walls.length; x++)
146        {
147            for(int y = 0; y < walls[0].length; y++)
148            {
149                resistanceMap[x][y] = (walls[x][y] == '#') ? 1.0 : 0.0;
150            }
151        }
152        return isReachable(resistanceMap, startx, starty, targetx, targety, radiusStrategy);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target
157     * point without intervening obstructions.
158     *
159     * Does not take into account resistance less than opaque or distance cost.
160     *
161     * Uses RadiusStrategy.CIRCLE, or whatever RadiusStrategy was set with setRadiusStrategy .
162     *
163     * @param resistanceMap 0.0 is fully transparent, 1.0 is fully opaque, as always this uses x,y indexing.
164     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
165     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
166     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
167     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
168     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
169     */
170    public boolean isReachable(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety) {
171        return isReachable(resistanceMap, startx, starty, targetx, targety, radiusStrategy);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target
176     * point without intervening obstructions.
177     *
178     * @param resistanceMap 0.0 is fully transparent, 1.0 is fully opaque, as always this uses x,y indexing.
179     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
180     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
181     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
182     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
183     * @param radiusStrategy the strategy to use in computing unit distance
184     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
185     */
186    public boolean isReachable(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety, Radius radiusStrategy) {
187        if(resistanceMap.length < 1) return false;
188        this.resistanceMap = resistanceMap;
189        this.startx = startx;
190        this.starty = starty;
191        this.targetx = targetx;
192        this.targety = targety;
193        switch (type) {
194            case BRESENHAM:
195                return bresenhamReachable(radiusStrategy);
196            case ELIAS:
197                return eliasReachable(radiusStrategy);
198            case RAY:
199                return rayReachable(radiusStrategy);
200            case ORTHO:
201                return orthoReachable(radiusStrategy);
202            case DDA:
203                return ddaReachable(radiusStrategy);
204            case THICK:
205                return thickReachable(radiusStrategy);
206        }
207        return false;
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target
212     * point without intervening obstructions.
213     *
214     * @param walls '#' is fully opaque, anything else is fully transparent, as always this uses x,y indexing.
215     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
216     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
217     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
218     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
219     * @param radiusStrategy the strategy to use in computing unit distance
220     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
221     */
222    public boolean isReachable(char[][] walls, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety, Radius radiusStrategy) {
223        if(walls.length < 1) return false;
224        if(resistanceMap == null || resistanceMap.length != walls.length || resistanceMap[0].length != walls[0].length)
225            resistanceMap = new double[walls.length][walls[0].length];
226        for(int x = 0; x < walls.length; x++)
227        {
228            for(int y = 0; y < walls[0].length; y++)
229            {
230                resistanceMap[x][y] = (walls[x][y] == '#') ? 1.0 : 0.0;
231            }
232        }
233        return isReachable(resistanceMap, startx, starty, targetx, targety, radiusStrategy);
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the any of the points within spread cells of the start point,
238     * to any of the corresponding points at the same direction and distance from the target point, without
239     * intervening obstructions. Primarily useful to paint a broad line that can be retrieved with getLastPath.
240     *
241     * @param walls '#' is fully opaque, anything else is fully transparent, as always this uses x,y indexing.
242     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
243     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
244     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
245     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
246     * @param radiusStrategy the strategy to use in computing unit distance
247     * @param spread the number of cells outward, measured by radiusStrategy, to place extra start and target points
248     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
249     */
250    public boolean spreadReachable(char[][] walls, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety, Radius radiusStrategy, int spread) {
251        if(walls.length < 1) return false;
252        if(resistanceMap == null || resistanceMap.length != walls.length || resistanceMap[0].length != walls[0].length)
253            resistanceMap = new double[walls.length][walls[0].length];
254        for(int x = 0; x < walls.length; x++)
255        {
256            for(int y = 0; y < walls[0].length; y++)
257            {
258                resistanceMap[x][y] = (walls[x][y] == '#') ? 1.0 : 0.0;
259            }
260        }
261        this.startx = startx;
262        this.starty = starty;
263        this.targetx = targetx;
264        this.targety = targety;
265
266        return brushReachable(radiusStrategy, spread);
267    }
268    /**
269     * Returns true if a line can be drawn from the any of the points within spread cells of the start point,
270     * to any of the corresponding points at the same direction and distance from the target point, without
271     * intervening obstructions. Primarily useful to paint a broad line that can be retrieved with getLastPath.
272     *
273     * @param resistanceMap 0.0 is fully transparent, 1.0 is fully opaque, as always this uses x,y indexing.
274     * @param startx starting x position on the grid
275     * @param starty starting y position on the grid
276     * @param targetx ending x position on the grid
277     * @param targety ending y position on the grid
278     * @param radiusStrategy the strategy to use in computing unit distance
279     * @param spread the number of cells outward, measured by radiusStrategy, to place extra start and target points
280     * @return true if a line can be drawn without being obstructed, false otherwise
281     */
282    public boolean spreadReachable(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety, Radius radiusStrategy, int spread) {
283        if(resistanceMap.length < 1) return false;
284        this.resistanceMap = resistanceMap;
285        this.startx = startx;
286        this.starty = starty;
287        this.targetx = targetx;
288        this.targety = targety;
289
290        return brushReachable(radiusStrategy, spread);
291    }
292    /**
293     * Returns the path of the last LOS calculation, with the starting point as
294     * the head of the queue.
295     *
296     * @return the last path found during LOS calculation, as a ArrayDeque of Coord with the starting point at the head
297     */
298    public ArrayDeque<Coord> getLastPath() {
299        return lastPath;
300    }
301/*
302    private boolean bresenhamReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
303        Queue<Coord> path = Bresenham.line2D(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
304        lastPath = new ArrayDeque<>();
305        lastPath.add(Coord.get(startx, starty));
306        double decay = 1 / radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
307        double currentForce = 1;
308        for (Coord p : path) {
309            lastPath.offer(p);
310            if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
311                return true;//reached the end 
312            }
313            if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
314                currentForce -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
315            }
316            double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
317            if (currentForce - (r * decay) <= 0) {
318                return false;//too much resistance
319            }
320        }
321        return false;//never got to the target point
322    }
323*/
324    private boolean bresenhamReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
325        Coord[] path = Bresenham.line2D_(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
326        lastPath.clear();
327        double rad = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
328        if(rad == 0.0) {
329            lastPath.add(Coord.get(startx, starty));
330            return true; // already at the point; we can see our own feet just fine!
331        }
332        double decay = 1 / rad;
333        double currentForce = 1;
334        Coord p;
335        for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
336            p = path[i];
337            lastPath.offer(p);
338            if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
339                return true;//reached the end
340            }
341            if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
342                currentForce -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
343            }
344            double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
345            if (currentForce - (r * decay) <= 0) {
346                return false;//too much resistance
347            }
348        }
349        return false;//never got to the target point
350    }
351
352    private boolean orthoReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
353        Coord[] path = OrthoLine.line_(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
354        lastPath.clear();
355        double rad = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
356        if(rad == 0.0) {
357            lastPath.add(Coord.get(startx, starty));
358            return true; // already at the point; we can see our own feet just fine!
359        }
360        double decay = 1.0 / rad;
361        double currentForce = 1;
362        Coord p;
363        for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
364            p = path[i];
365            lastPath.offer(p);
366            if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
367                return true;//reached the end
368            }
369            if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
370                currentForce -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
371            }
372            double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
373            if (currentForce - (r * decay) <= 0) {
374                return false;//too much resistance
375            }
376        }
377        return false;//never got to the target point
378    }
379
380    private boolean ddaReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
381        Coord[] path = DDALine.line_(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
382        lastPath.clear();
383        double rad = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
384        if(rad == 0.0) {
385            lastPath.add(Coord.get(startx, starty));
386            return true; // already at the point; we can see our own feet just fine!
387        }
388        double decay = 1 / rad;
389        double currentForce = 1;
390        Coord p;
391        for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
392            p = path[i];
393            if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
394                lastPath.offer(p);
395                return true;//reached the end
396            }
397            if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
398                currentForce -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
399            }
400            double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
401            if (currentForce - (r * decay) <= 0) {
402                return false;//too much resistance
403            }
404            lastPath.offer(p);
405        }
406        return false;//never got to the target point
407    }
408
409    private boolean thickReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
410        lastPath.clear();
411        double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
412        double decay = 1.0 / dist; // note: decay can be positive infinity if dist is 0; this is actually OK
413        OrderedSet<Coord> visited = new OrderedSet<>((int) dist + 3);
414        List<List<Coord>> paths = new ArrayList<>(4);
415        /* // actual corners
416        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0, 0));
417        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0, 0xffff));
418        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0xffff, 0));
419        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0xffff, 0xffff));
420        */
421        // halfway between the center and a corner
422        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0x3fff, 0x3fff));
423        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0x3fff, 0xbfff));
424        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0xbfff, 0x3fff));
425        paths.add(DDALine.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety, 0xbfff, 0xbfff));
426
427        int length = Math.max(paths.get(0).size(), Math.max(paths.get(1).size(),
428                Math.max(paths.get(2).size(), paths.get(3).size())));
429        double[] forces = new double[]{1,1,1,1};
430        boolean[] go = new boolean[]{true, true, true, true};
431        Coord p;
432        for (int d = 0; d < length; d++) {
433            for (int pc = 0; pc < 4; pc++) {
434                List<Coord> path = paths.get(pc);
435                if(d < path.size() && go[pc])
436                    p = path.get(d);
437                else continue;
438                if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
439                    visited.add(p);
440                    lastPath.addAll(visited);
441                    return true;//reached the end
442                }
443                if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
444                    forces[pc] -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
445                }
446                double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
447                if (forces[pc] - (r * decay) <= 0) {
448                    go[pc] = false;
449                    continue;//too much resistance
450                }
451                visited.add(p);
452            }
453        }
454        lastPath.addAll(visited);
455        return false;//never got to the target point
456    }
457
458    private boolean brushReachable(Radius radiusStrategy, int spread) {
459        lastPath.clear();
460        double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety) + spread * 2;
461        OrderedSet<Coord> visited = new OrderedSet<>((int) (dist + 3) * spread);
462//        List<List<Coord>> paths = new ArrayList<>((int) (radiusStrategy.volume2D(spread) * 1.25));
463//        int length = 0;
464//        List<Coord> currentPath;
465        int sx = startx, sy = starty, tx = targetx, ty = targety;
466        for (int i = -spread; i <= spread; i++) {
467            startx = sx + i;
468            targetx = tx + i;
469            for (int j = -spread; j <= spread; j++) {
470                if(radiusStrategy.inRange(sx, sy, sx + i, sy + j, 0, spread)
471                        && sx + i >= 0 && sy + j >= 0
472                        && sx + i < resistanceMap.length && sy + j < resistanceMap[0].length
473                        && tx + i >= 0 && ty + j >= 0
474                        && tx + i < resistanceMap.length && ty + j < resistanceMap[0].length) {
475//                    for (int q = 0x3fff; q < 0xffff; q += 0x8000) {
476//                        for (int r = 0x3fff; r < 0xffff; r += 0x8000) {
477                            starty = sy + j;
478                            targety = ty + j;
479                            if(ddaReachable(radiusStrategy))
480                                visited.addAll(lastPath);
481//                            currentPath = DDALine.line(startx+i, starty+j, targetx+i, targety+j, q, r);
482//                            paths.add(currentPath);
483//                            length = Math.max(length, currentPath.size());
484
485//                        }
486//                    }
487                }
488            }
489        }
490        lastPath.clear();
491        lastPath.addAll(visited);
492        return !lastPath.isEmpty();
493//        double force;
494////        boolean[] go = new boolean[paths.size()];
495////        Arrays.fill(go, true);
496//        Coord p;
497////        boolean found = false;
498//        for (int pc = 0; pc < paths.size(); pc++) {
499//            List<Coord> path = paths.get(pc);
500//            force = 1.0;
501//            for (int d = 0; d < path.size(); d++) {                  
502//                p = path.get(d);
503//                //else continue;
504////                if (p.x == targetx && p.y == targety) {
505////                    found = true;
506////                }
507//                if (p.x != startx || p.y != starty) {//don't discount the start location even if on resistant cell
508//                    force -= resistanceMap[p.x][p.y];
509//                }
510//                //double r = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y);
511//                if (force <= 0) {
512//                    //go[pc] = false;
513//                    break;//too much resistance
514//                }
515//                visited.add(p);
516//            }
517//        }
518//        lastPath.addAll(visited);
519//        return true;//visited.contains(Coord.get(targetx, targety));
520    }
521
522    private boolean rayReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
523        lastPath.clear();//save path for later retrieval
524        if (startx == targetx && starty == targety) {//already there!
525            lastPath.add(Coord.get(startx, starty));
526            return true;
527        }
528
529        int width = resistanceMap.length;
530        int height = resistanceMap[0].length;
531
532        Coord end = Coord.get(targetx, targety);
533        //find out which direction to step, on each axis
534        int stepX = targetx == startx ? 0 : (targetx - startx >> 31 | 1), // signum with less converting to/from float
535                stepY = targety == starty ? 0 : (targety - starty >> 31 | 1);
536
537        int deltaY = Math.abs(targetx - startx),
538                deltaX = Math.abs(targety - starty);
539
540        int testX = startx,
541                testY = starty;
542
543        int maxX = deltaX,
544                maxY = deltaY;
545
546        while (testX >= 0 && testX < width && testY >= 0 && testY < height && (testX != targetx || testY != targety)) {
547            lastPath.add(Coord.get(testX, testY));
548            if (maxY - maxX > deltaX) {
549                maxX += deltaX;
550                testX += stepX;
551                if (resistanceMap[testX][testY] >= 1f) {
552                    end = Coord.get(testX, testY);
553                    break;
554                }
555            } else if (maxX - maxY > deltaY) {
556                maxY += deltaY;
557                testY += stepY;
558                if (resistanceMap[testX][testY] >= 1f) {
559                    end = Coord.get(testX, testY);
560                    break;
561                }
562            } else {//directly on diagonal, move both full step
563                maxY += deltaY;
564                testY += stepY;
565                maxX += deltaX;
566                testX += stepX;
567                if (resistanceMap[testX][testY] >= 1f) {
568                    end = Coord.get(testX, testY);
569                    break;
570                }
571            }
572            if (radiusStrategy.radius(testX, testY, startx, starty) > radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, end.x, end.y)) {//went too far
573                break;
574            }
575        }
576
577        if (end.x >= 0 && end.x < width && end.y >= 0 && end.y < height) {
578            lastPath.add(Coord.get(end.x, end.y));
579        }
580
581        return end.x == targetx && end.y == targety;
582    }
583
584    private boolean eliasReachable(Radius radiusStrategy) {
585        if(elias == null)
586        {
587            elias = new Elias();
588            los1 = new LOS(BRESENHAM);
589            los2 = new LOS(BRESENHAM);
590        }
591        final ArrayList<Coord> ePath = elias.line(startx, starty, targetx, targety);
592//        // very similar to RNG.shuffleInPlace(); this may be handy for getting an early shortcut return
593//        final int n = ePath.size();
594//        long state = 0x58476D1CE4E5B9BFL;
595//        for (int i = n; i > 1; i--) {
596//            // inlined LightRNG.determineBounded(); can replace *= with usually-faster +=
597//            Collections.swap(ePath, (int)((i * (((state = ((state = ((state += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) ^ state >>> 30) * 0xBF58476D1CE4E5B9L) ^ state >>> 27) * 0x94D049BB133111EBL) ^ state >>> 31) & 0x7FFFFFFFL)) >> 31), i - 1);
598//        }
599        for(Coord p : ePath)
600        {
601            //if a non-solid midpoint on the path can see both the start and end, consider the two ends to be able to see each other
602            if (resistanceMap[p.x][p.y] < 1
603                    && radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, p.x, p.y) <= radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, targetx, targety)
604                    && los1.isReachable(resistanceMap, p.x, p.y, targetx, targety, radiusStrategy)
605                    && los2.isReachable(resistanceMap, startx, starty, p.x, p.y, radiusStrategy)) {
606
607                //record actual sight path used
608                lastPath.clear();
609                lastPath.addAll(los2.lastPath);
610                lastPath.remove(p); // should be the only overlapping point
611                lastPath.addAll(los1.lastPath);
612                return true;
613            }
614
615        }
616        return false;//never got to the target point
617    }
618}
